definition: could happen at any moment/on the verge
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
to touch/to make contact with sth/to stir up sb's emotions
namely/that is/i.e./prompt/at once/at present/even if/prompted (by the occasion)/to approach/to come into contact/to assume (office)/to draw near
hair/Taiwan pr. [fa3]
to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)

sentences.english: Surgent power output of All New Bora makes your driving pleasure easy on the trigger.
sentences.chinese: 全新宝来澎湃的动力输出让您的驾驶乐趣一触即发。

sentences.english: There is always a danger of marriage taking the razor edge off the passion for Jesus and souls.
sentences.chinese: 阙如对耶稣及对人的热爱，婚姻的危机常会一触即发。

sentences.english: Armed conflict may break out at any moment.
sentences.chinese: 武装冲突有一触即发之势。

sentences.english: The prospect of a new trade war.
sentences.chinese: 一触即发的新一轮贸易战。

sentences.english: President Adams did not call for a declaration of war, but hostilities began at sea.
sentences.chinese: 亚当斯总统并未宣战，但是战争在海边一触即发。

sentences.english: Red and blue hair-trigger World War II this weekend.
sentences.chinese: 红蓝大战本周末一触即发。

sentences.english: This can set off the pain cascade with hair-trigger sensitivity.
sentences.chinese: 这种疼痛由一触即发的敏感灵敏性激发级联反应。

sentences.english: Revolution is in the air. Can’t you feel it?
sentences.chinese: 现在革命是一触即发，难道你们感觉不到吗？

sentences.english: A king and the apostles to the truth and honor campaign triggered at any moment.
sentences.chinese: 一场王爵和使徒们为了真相和荣誉的战役一触即发。

sentences.english: Fortress filling amuck and wars being going to launch.
sentences.chinese: 军事要塞充满肃杀感，战事一触即发。

sentences.english: Despite the threat of war, people go about their work as usual.
sentences.chinese: 尽管战争一触即发，人们仍像平时一样工作。

sentences.english: Pachacutec scanned the enemy ranks in silence, preparing for the great battle ahead.
sentences.chinese: 帕恰库德无声的审视着敌方阵营，大战一触即发。

definition: lit. with swords drawn and bows bent (idiom); fig. a state of mutual hostility/at daggers drawn
to wait for action after having accumulated power, energy etc
ever more critical/problems get more and more intense
to arise again/to make a comeback/resurgence
to turn white-hot/to intensify/to reach a climax
lit. short-weaponed soldiery fight one another (idiom); fierce hand-to-hand infantry combat/to fight at close quarters
to break out/to erupt/to explode/to burst out
(literary) deeply worried
lit. storm clouds approach/troubles lie ahead (idiom)
lit. fire beacons in all four directions (idiom); the confusion of war
near at hand/imminent/within sight
chaotic warfare/confused fighting/melee/to join in such fighting
lit. you die, I live (idiom); irreconcilable adversaries/two parties cannot coexist
to stand opposite/to confront/confrontation
evenly matched (idiom)
to start a war/to make war/to battle against
